document_data.name: Maranthae
document_data.mainbody: The '''maranthae''' was a flower, most common in the area once occupied by [[Eaerlann]].
document_data.Description: The small flower grew in woodlands. It had petals that were gold in color, and rich blue at the hub, shading progressively between the two colors within a third of their length. The whole flower gave off a very faint glow, which it absorbed from available light sources.
document_data.History: [[Eaerlann]] used the maranthae as its symbol during its height.
